sentences.en: Because a prairie is wide therefore debauchery is admirable.
sentences.cn: 因为草原辽阔,所以放荡值得钦佩.

sentences.en: Coran, you make me doubt that debauchery is its own punishment.
sentences.cn: 科朗, 你有时会让我觉得放荡本身就是一种惩罚.

sentences.en: Do not get drunk on wine, which leads to debauchery. Instead, be filled with the Spirit.
sentences.cn: 不要醉酒, 酒能使人放荡, 乃要被圣灵充满.

sentences.en: Goes to the debauchery the recreation area, also with police status symbol.
sentences.cn: 去灯红酒绿的娱乐场所, 也和警察身份不符.

sentences.en: If not depraved by early debauchery, his life would have been fit for better things.
sentences.cn: 要不是早年放荡堕落, 他一生也会做出比较出色的事情的.

sentences.en: It is not the object of debauchery that excites us, rather the idea of evil.
sentences.cn: 让我们兴奋的不是沉溺肉欲, 而是罪恶的念头.

sentences.en: Love is related to purity , beauty , and goodness , while lust relates to filth, debauchery, and lewdness.
sentences.cn: 爱情是跟纯洁和美善联系在一起的, 而情欲却是跟污秽和邪荡联系在一起的.

sentences.en: They often mistake so totally, as to imagine that debauchery is pleasure.
sentences.cn: 他们常犯大错, 误以为放荡就是享乐.

sentences.en: Those allowed to be called debauchery era youth.
sentences.cn: 那些、允许放荡的年代、被叫做青春.

sentences.en: Verse 25 tells us that the celebration degraded to revelry and debauchery. All restraint was gone.
sentences.cn: 第25节告诉我们这样的庆祝仪式已坠落到饮酒狂欢和寻欢作乐.

words.tran_cn: 使堕落；放荡（debauch的过去分词）
放荡；诱使做不道德的事

trans.tran_cn: 道德败坏，淫荡，放荡，淫逸
trans.tran_en: immoral behaviour involving drugs, alcohol, sex etc
